messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re:  Questions from a Newbie!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/25/00 7:49:49 AM Eastern Daylight Time, mommiesapp@cs.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/25/00 7:49:49 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
mommiesapp@... writes:

<< I am having with my 3 year old and she will
always yell back at me "I don't want to make a choice!". Anyway, I will try
to e-mail you privately -- thanks for the offer and advice!.
>>
Oh how I wish this was my case then I could just do my preference and when
she screams I could tell her, "this is the consquences of you not making a
decision. You end up having to do things you really don't want to" This is
the conversation that I get..."I WANT to do this........." "That is not one
of the choices. Here are the choices........" but "I want to do
this.............." over and over again....

Julie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re:  Questions from a Newbie!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/25/2000 6:50:46 AM Central Daylight Time, ... type ... try ... Fay and Cline have a brand new book coming out applying Love and Logic
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/25/2000 6:50:46 AM Central Daylight Time,
mommiesapp@... writes:

> Carron -- I have read the book you are referring to and I am currently
> waiting for my library to get me 2 other works by those authors -- that
type
>
> of discipline totally makes sense to me but the book I read seems to NOT
> cover the type of situations I am having with my 3 year old and she will
> always yell back at me "I don't want to make a choice!". Anyway, I will
try
>
> to e-mail you privately -- thanks for the offer and advice!.


Fay and Cline have a brand new book coming out applying Love and Logic
principles to toddlers and preschoolers, but it's so new that I don't have a
copy yet. Maybe that's one of the ones you're looking for.

By the way -- one of the consequences of not making a choice is that mommy
and daddy get to make the choice. So, when one of my kids said, "I don't
want to make a choice," I'd say very calmly, "OK, then I get to choose, and I
choose (whatever)." It didn't take them long to figure out that they were
giving away their control over the situation.

Carron
